intro: Nissolia stipulata, commonly known as the stipulate nissolia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its small, white to pinkish flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, dry fruits known as capsules. Nissolia stipulata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
